title: Comparative Educational Course: Learner-Controlled vs. Adaptive Program-Controlled Learning in Chemical Metrology

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Learning chemical metrology concepts using digital devices and solving real-life problems through PBL (Project-Based Learning) projects

learning_goals: Learners will be able to apply four conversion rules (a–d) between moles and grams with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners will be able to independently solve at least 20 practice problems under both learner-controlled (LC) and adaptive program-controlled (PC) strategies.
Learners will be able to compare that the PC strategy demonstrates 15% or higher accuracy than the LC strategy in immediate/delayed assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
